results.title: The Brown dressing gown
results.brief_description: Patric fondly remembers his social worker Julie Wilson who helped him come out of his cocoon and discard his brown dressing gown. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and The Deafness Foundation.
results.description: Patric fondly remembers his social worker Julie Wilson who helped him come out of his cocoon and discard his brown dressing gown. This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with the Department of Human Services and The Deafness Foundation.

results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Bidja Atkinson

results.title: Don't tell me I can't
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Krystyna Popczyk
results.brief_description: This is a daughter’s dedication to her mother. Krystina’s mother managed a vision and hearing impairment with great courage and a ‘don’t tell me I can’t’ attitude.

results.title: Days of Echuca
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Barbara Day
results.brief_description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.
results.description: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.
description_for_label: Barbara courageously and openly speaks of the hardships she has endured in her life and how she has managed to recover from the tragedies of her life because she draws support from her spirituality, her family and her community. This story was produced as part of a project called Voices from the Riverlands, in partnership with the Njernda Aboriginal Corporation.
